title: During their 40 years in the desert, what did the Israelites eat? - Quora

response.answer_text: Survival in a desert should always hold water as priority over food. Eating food will just dehydrate you more if you haven't got the fluids to back it up. But anyway, food: the easiest food they would have been able to acquire is fruits of cactus, In which all are edible and not overly difficult to obtain. Of course, cactus are also a good source of fluid. Afew plants and shrubs are edible to. Such as Acacia leaves, flowers and pods. Obviously, animals would provide a source of food to. Reptiles are an easier creature to catch, and provide the fats and protein they would need to survive.
Well, that nice little fictional myths states that they had to eat what they found as they ran around in circles. So much for “god’s” guidance.
